head.supplied: 22/1/78. ¶ ¶ Be so kind to tell me, dear Mr Ramsay, from whence the plant came, of which you sent a fragment. ¶ It will facilitate fixing its name, especially in the absense of even young fruit. Any...

div.p: ML MSS.562, Letters to E. P. Ramsay 1862-91, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Be so kind to tell me, dear Mr Ramsay, from whence the plant came, of which you sent a fragment.
See postscript to E. Ramsay to M, 15 January 1878. It will facilitate fixing its name, especially in the absense of even young fruit. Any how I cannot leave my arrear-work until after the despatch of the next English mail. I am delighted at the prospects of getting more palms from the north, — let the flowers & fruits in each instance be carefully packed together with the leaves.
When is the Rev Mr Lawes leaving for Melbourne
